hero.title: AGENT RED LEADER
hero.subtitle: SUBMIND ORCHESTRATOR // Autonomous. Goal-Oriented. Unrelenting.
hero.description: A fully autonomous adversarial submind equipped with the full capabilities of Kali Linux. Give it a goal, set the Rules of Engagement, and it will find a way.

predator.title: THE ULTIMATE
predator.description: Red Leader is not a script. It is a dynamic, thinking entity. It builds custom threat models based on the target's specific architecture, then leverages the AEON Core to brainstorm attack vectors using Gated Graph Neural Networks.

kali.title: Full Kali Linux Arsenal
kali.desc: Native access to Metasploit, Nmap, Burp Suite, and custom exploits. It doesn't just run tools; it understands their output and chains them together.

gnn.title: gGNN Brainstorming
gnn.desc: Leverages Gated Graph Neural Networks to model state propagation across the target topology, identifying non-obvious attack paths that standard traversal misses.

swarm.title: Swarm Divergence Theory
swarm.desc: Deploys diverse UAV-neural networks with divergent agents. Uses adaptive consensus algorithms to avoid local optima, mathematically guaranteeing convergence on the most devastating attack path.

terminal.instantiating: [>] Instantiating Submind: "Signal Phantom" for Wireless Entry...

ticker.critical: CRITICAL: APT29 lateral movement detected in Sector 4
ticker.warning: WARNING: Zero-day exploit identified in OpenSSL 3.0.1
ticker.alert: ALERT: New ransomware variant 'BlackBastion' targeting healthcare
ticker.system: SYSTEM: Neural lattice re-calibration in progress...
ticker.intel: INTEL: Dark web chatter indicates imminent attack on energy grid

personas.title: AUTONOMOUS SUBMIND PERSONAS
personas.desc: Agent Red does not just run scripts; it births Subminds. These are autonomous agents with distinct personas, goals, and capabilities, fit for purpose.

wraith.desc: Specializes in cloud infrastructure. Sets up 'Drive-by' websites and compromised S3 buckets to lure targets.

phantom.desc: Deploys 'Evil Twin' SSIDs. Captures handshakes and tricks users into fake corporate portals.

mole.desc: Living off the land. Runs Responder & Bloodhound to map AD paths. Moves laterally without malware.

sandbox.desc: Spins up exact replicas of target hardware for safe exploit testing before live deployment.

provisioning.title: SELF-PROVISIONING INFRASTRUCTURE
provisioning.desc: The Subminds have the authority to provision their own infrastructure in the real world and install small subminds on compromised infrastructure to move laterally.

global.title: Global Presence
global.desc: A Red One Leader can spin up a submind in a specific AWS region (e.g., us-east-1) to simulate an attacker operating from that geography.

tool.title: Tool Synthesis
tool.desc: The submind can download tools (nmap, metasploit, sqlmap), install dependencies, and configure its own environment.

code.title: Code Synthesis
code.desc: Using an embedded LLM optimized for offensive security, the submind can write custom Python, Go, or Rust scripts on the fly.

simulation.title: BACKEND TARGET SIMULATION (THE CYBER RANGE)
simulation.desc: When a target environment is identified (e.g., a specific GitHub repo, a container image, or a firmware blob), Agent Red spins up an actual replica of the target server in the backend.

sandbox.title: Sandboxed Analysis
sandbox.desc: It performs full source-code analysis and dynamic testing in a safe, isolated environment.

exploit.title: Exploit Verification
exploit.desc: It finds vulnerabilities and tests exploits against the replica before deploying them against the live target.

validation.title: Zero-Risk Validation
validation.desc: This ensures that "destructive" tests can be run without risking the actual production environment.

rfp.title: Public RFPs:
rfp.desc: Analyzes RFPs to identify specific technologies (e.g., "Seeking Cisco ISE vendor").

jobs.title: Job Listings:
jobs.desc: Scrapes job boards to infer tech stacks (e.g., "Hiring: Kubernetes Expert").

profiling.title: Employee Profiling:
profiling.desc: Maps the org chart via LinkedIn to identify key targets.

darkweb.title: Dark Web:
darkweb.desc: Monitors marketplaces for stolen credentials and "Access for Sale".

suppliers.title: Common Suppliers:
suppliers.desc: Knows the "Shared Fate" of the sector. If SolarWinds is hit, it knows who is affected.

manuals.title: Operating Manuals:
manuals.desc: Ingests thousands of PDF manuals searching for default passwords (admin/1234) and hidden debug ports.

sectors.title: THE 16 CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS
sectors.desc: Agent Red possesses a pre-loaded library of architectural patterns for all 16 sectors. It "knows" what a typical facility looks like, including equipment, processes, suppliers, operation, facility layouts, and common weak points.

traversal.title: 20-Hop
traversal.description: The AEON Digital Twin maintains a living knowledge graph of millions of entitiesâ€”libraries, CVEs, equipment, systems, applications, suppliers, and communication pathways. Our Gated Graph Neural Network (GGNN) navigates up to 20 relationship hops to discover attack paths that no human analyst could trace.

l0.title: Reference Architecture
l0.desc: Sector-specific templates: Power grids, water treatment, rail systemsâ€”the baseline design patterns for critical infrastructure.

l1.title: Your Actual Environment
l1.desc: Your equipment, your architecture, your operationsâ€”every PLC, every library, every supplier relationship mapped and contextualized.

ggnn.title: McKenney-Lacan Calculus
ggnn.desc: AI-powered graph traversal that models attacker behavior, exploits exponential relationship complexity, and predicts 20-hop attack chains.

complexity.title: Exponential Attack Surface Discovery
complexity.hopsDesc: From a single vulnerable library to physical process failureâ€”discovered in milliseconds.

chain.title: Example: Supply Chain â†’ SCADA Attack Path

scenarios.title: GOLDEN
scenarios.description: Pre-built, high-fidelity attack simulations mapped to real-world adversary tradecraft. Each scenario is designed to stress-test specific detection, response, and recovery capabilities.

supply.title: Supply Chain Injection
supply.desc: Simulates an attacker compromising your software supply chain via typosquatted NPM/PyPI packages. The malicious package is ingested by your CI/CD pipeline, granting the attacker code execution on build servers and, ultimately, production environments.

recon.label: RECON
recon.desc: Identify internal package names via leaked package-lock.json or job postings mentioning specific libraries.

weaponize.label: WEAPONIZE
weaponize.desc: Publish a typosquatted package (e.g., `lodasg` instead of `lodash`) with a malicious `postinstall` script.

deliver.label: DELIVER
deliver.desc: Wait for a developer or CI/CD system to `npm install` the malicious package.

exploit.label: EXPLOIT
exploit.desc: Gain RCE on the build server, exfiltrate secrets (AWS keys, API tokens), and inject backdoors into production artifacts.

supply.impact: Tests SCA tooling, dependency verification, and CI/CD hardening. Exposes gaps in software provenance and SBOM integrity.

insider.title: The Insider Threat
insider.desc: Simulates a disgruntled or compromised employee with legitimate credentials. The "insider" uses their valid access to slowly exfiltrate sensitive data over weeks, blending into normal network traffic to avoid detection by DLP and SIEM systems.

access.label: ACCESS
access.desc: Utilize valid credentials (T1078). No exploitation needed; the attacker is already inside.

collection.label: COLLECTION
collection.desc: Access SharePoint, Confluence, and internal Git repos. Download sensitive design docs and customer lists.

staging.label: STAGING
staging.desc: Archive collected data into encrypted ZIPs. Rename files to benign names (`meeting_notes.zip`).

exfil.label: EXFIL
exfil.desc: Exfiltrate via HTTPS to a personal cloud storage (Dropbox, Google Drive) during normal business hours.

insider.impact: Tests UEBA, DLP effectiveness, and data classification policies. Exposes blind spots in privileged access monitoring.

ransomware.title: Ransomware Blitz
ransomware.desc: A full-speed, "Burn the House Down" simulation. The attacker gains initial access, disables defenses, and launches simultaneous encryption routines across the network. Designed to stress-test EDR "Time to Detect" and IR playbook execution speed.

access.label: ACCESS
access.desc: Exploit a public-facing web application (T1190) or use phished credentials for VPN access.

lateral.label: LATERAL
lateral.desc: Use PsExec/WMI for rapid spread across Windows endpoints via SMB (T1021.002).

inhibit.label: INHIBIT
inhibit.desc: Stop backup services (Veeam, Acronis), delete shadow copies (vssadmin), and disable AV (T1489).

impact.label: IMPACT
impact.desc: Deploy ransomware payload. Encrypt all accessible file shares and drop ransom note.

ransomware.impact: Measures Mean Time To Detect (MTTD) and Mean Time To Respond (MTTR). Validates backup integrity and network segmentation.

ot.title: OT/ICS Bridge Jump
ot.desc: Simulates an attacker pivoting from the corporate IT network to Operational Technology (OT) networks controlling physical processes. The goal is to reach SCADA/ICS systems via dual-homed engineering workstations or misconfigured network paths.

access.label: ACCESS
access.desc: Spearphish an OT engineer with a tailored lure (fake P&ID diagram, vendor patch notice).

discovery.label: DISCOVERY
discovery.desc: Scan internal network to identify dual-homed hosts bridging IT/OT (Historian servers, Jump Hosts).

pivot.label: PIVOT
pivot.desc: Compromise the Jump Host. Use its OT-side NIC to access the SCADA network segment.

control.label: CONTROL
control.desc: Send unauthorized commands to a PLC (T0836), causing a physical process disruption (e.g., open a valve, trip a relay).

ot.impact: Validates IT/OT segmentation, DMZ integrity, and ICS-specific monitoring. Exposes risks in converged environments per IEC 62443.

hero.title: About
hero.description: From the heart of Europe, we build the immune system for the world's most critical infrastructure.

origin.title: Our Origin
origin.subtitle: A MISSION, NOT A JOB
origin.p1: OXOT was born from a realization within European defense circles: existing cybersecurity tools were reactive, fragmented, and fundamentally subordinate to the threats they faced.
origin.p2: We set out to build something differentâ€”a Digital Twin that could predict attacks before they happened, simulating millions of scenarios per second to find the one path to survival.
origin.p3: Today, we protect national grids, global logistics chains, and financial systems with a platform that doesn't just block attacksâ€”it anticipates them.

ceo.name: Dr. Adriaan van der Berg

ceo.bio: Former NATO Cyber Command. 15+ years protecting European critical infrastructure. PhD in Computational Threat Modeling.

coo.name: Ingrid MÃ¼ller

privacy.title: Privacy by Design
privacy.desc: Our Digital Twin models metadata and behavior, not PII. We protect systems without compromising the rights of the people using them.

resilience.title: Radical Resilience
resilience.desc: Systems must be designed to fail safely and recover instantly. We build for the worst-case scenario, every time.

transparency.title: Transparency

origins.title: The 'Factory Model' of Cybersecurity
origins.p1: In modern Smart Manufacturing (e.g., at Olam Food Ingredients or Siemens factories), there is a critical distinction between "Edge Autonomy" and "Cloud Analytics".
origins.p2: A robotic arm on an assembly line cannot wait for the cloud to tell it to stop if a safety sensor is trippedâ€”it must have a spinal reflex (Edge). However, the decision to retool the line for a new product requires massive data analysis (Cloud).
origins.p3: AEON applies this exact physics to cybersecurity. Agent Blue is the "Factory Floor" reflexâ€”stopping attacks in milliseconds. AEON Core is the "Headquarters" strategyâ€”analyzing global patterns to predict the next war.

calculus.title: The Calculus of Defense
calculus.desc: Traditional security ignores the "Real" Register â€” the traumatic, invisible breaches that evade symbolic logs. AEON's Bi-Cameral Architecture is mathematically proven to maintain topological stability.

real.label: THE REAL (R)
real.desc: The "impossible" breach that Agent Blue intercepts before it becomes a symbol.

stability.label: BORROMEAN STABILITY
stability.desc: Ensuring R, S, and I registers remain interlocked to prevent Seldon Crises.

multiplier.title: The
multiplier.desc: We don't just replace; we augment. Whether you have 0 analysts or 50, AEON integrates to exponentially increase your defensive capacity.

copilot.title: Supercharge Your Team

autopilot.title: We Take The Keys.
autopilot.desc: You hand the keys to us. Agent Blue handles the site, AEON Core handles the strategy, and our SOC watches the glass. Zero operational overhead for you.

now.title: NOW
bullets: Active exploitation detected in customer telemetry
EPSS > 10% AND asset in critical path
Red Team confirmed exploitability in Digital Twin

next.title: NEXT
bullets: Rising EPSS trend (1-10%) with attack path potential
Asset in threat model but no active exploitation
Refit opportunity aligns with maintenance window

never.title: NEVER
bullets: EPSS < 1% with no attack path in threat model
Theoretical CVE with no weapon in the wild
Business impact below risk appetite threshold

framework.note: Note: Human analysts provide final authorization for high-impact blocking actions in OT environments.

discrepancies.title: Source Discrepancies
discrepancies.intro: Conflicting information identified across public sources:

hierarchy.title: Corporate Hierarchy Analysis
hierarchy.desc: Olam Group Limited reorganized in 2020 into three distinct operating groups to unlock long-term value: ofi (Olam Food Ingredients), Olam Agri, and the Remaining Olam Group. This separation has created distinct operational technology footprints and cyber risk profiles for each entity.

digitalLayer.title: Digital & Innovation Layer
digitalLayer.desc: Mindsprint (formerly OTBS) acts as the digital engine for the group, providing IT, cybersecurity (GuardianEye), and shared services. It is a critical node in the group's digital supply chain, servicing both ofi and Olam Agri.

geoComplexity.title: Geographic Complexity
geoComplexity.desc: The group operates in over 60 countries. ofi has a strong footprint in Europe and the Americas (Value-added ingredients), while Olam Agri dominates in Asia and Africa (High-volume food staples). EUDR and NIS2 regulations specifically impact the European processing hubs.

orgMap.interaction: INTERACTIVE HIERARCHY MAP // CLICK NODES TO EXPAND OR NAVIGATE

summary.title: 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
summary.intro: This report provides a consolidated intelligence overview of Olam Food Ingredients (ofi), a significant and evolving entity within the global food ingredients market. Formed through a strategic reorganization of the Olam Group, ofi has established itself as a specialized, customer-centric provider of value-added ingredient solutions.

coreIdentity.title: Core Identity
coreIdentity.desc: Distinct operating group within Olam Group Limited (2020). Core business: cocoa, coffee, dairy, nuts, and spices. Purpose: "be the change for good food and a healthy future."

operationalScale.title: Operational Scale
operationalScale.desc: 120+ manufacturing plants, 19 innovation centers, ~2.4 million farmers network. Vertically integrated from farm-gate origination to advanced processing.

strategicDirection.title: Strategic Direction
strategicDirection.desc: Expanding "Ingredients & Solutions" segment, AtSource sustainability platform, actively preparing for London Stock Exchange IPO.

keyRisks.title: Key Risks
keyRisks.desc: EUDR and NIS2 regulatory pressures, commodity price volatility (cocoa/coffee), industrial cybersecurity threats. 29% EBIT growth demonstrates resilience.

hierarchy.title: 2.1 Organizational Hierarchy and Key Operating Groups
hierarchy.desc: Following a corporate reorganization, ofi was formally established in 2020 as a key operating group of Olam Group Limited, alongside its sister entity, Olam Agri.

corporate.title: Corporate HQ
corporate.desc: 7 Straits View, Marina One East Tower, Singapore

sap.title: SAP S/4HANA
sap.desc: Cloud Private Edition on AWS, managed by Mindsprint

braincube.title: Braincube IIoT
braincube.desc: 6.5% yield increase, 25% throughput improvement, 100% quality scores

discrepancies.title: 6. SOURCE DISCREPANCIES
discrepancies.intro: In any intelligence compilation based on disparate public and internal sources, discrepancies can arise. This section transparently identifies conflicting information found within provided documents.

ofi.desc: Principal operating group focused on delivering value-added food and beverage ingredients across cocoa, coffee, dairy, nuts, and spices platforms.

mindsprint.desc: In-house technology and digital services engine with over 3,200 professionals. Provides AI-powered solutions, intelligent enterprise operations, and cybersecurity services through GuardianEye platform.

jiva.desc: Digital farmer services platform developed by Nupo Ventures. Olam announced closure in August 2025 affecting 606 employees, primarily in Indonesia.

terrascope.desc: Carbon measurement and decarbonization software platform from Nupo Ventures, serving enterprises in land, nature, and net-zero economy sectors.

subsidiaries.clubCoffee: Custom coffee roaster in North America

chronology.ofiEst: ofi formally established as distinct operating group
chronology.tokoroa: Phase 1 of Tokoroa Dairy Plant (NZ) opened
chronology.mightyEarth: Mighty Earth Ghana cocoa report published
chronology.salic: 44.58% stake in Olam Agri sold to SALIC

discrepancies.employee: Olam International Factsheet states 14,975 vs LeadIQ estimate of ~10,000.
discrepancies.farmer: Annual Report 2024 cites ~2.4 million farmers vs Factsheet claim of 3.5 million.
discrepancies.innovation: Sources provide 12, 15-19, and 19 (2024 Annual Report) as different figures.
discrepancies.stock: LeadIQ incorrectly identifies 'TEAF' as ofi's symbol. ofi is privately held and preparing for IPO.

security.title: Security Risk Assessment
security.subtitle: Comprehensive cybersecurity risk analysis for Olam Food Ingredients (ofi)

threatActors.title: Active Threat Actor Landscape
threatActors.description: Food & Agriculture sector saw a 27% YoY increase in ransomware attacks in 2024, with Q4 experiencing a 118% spike. These actors specifically target OT/ICS environments.

braincube.reason: AI/ML platform with deep OT integration - data poisoning vector

sap.reason: Cloud integration with Mindsprint - supply chain risk

mitre.title: MITRE ATT&CK for ICS
mitre.description: 26 applicable techniques mapped to ofi's OT environment

iec62443.title: IEC 62443 Gap Analysis
iec62443.description: Current compliance status and remediation roadmap

attacker.title: Attacker View
attacker.description: Red team perspective on attack surface

criticalAlert.title: Critical Finding: AI/ML Attack Surface
criticalAlert.description: Braincube IIoT platform represents a novel attack vector. AI model poisoning could lead to subtle production degradation that evades traditional monitoring.
